caseTitle: Ch. Nazir Ahmed v. Ali Ahmed, etc
tagline: A suit for rendition of accounts shall be competent by the partner(s) of unregistered firm against the other, however, with the clear limitation and qualifier that the firm should have already been dissolved and if not so, be first sought to be dissolved, because an exclusive and simple suit for the rendition of accounts while the partnership/firm is in existence shall not be competent in view of the absolute bar contained in section 69 of the Partnership Act, 1932.
